title: Revelation: The Risen Lord Speaks
objective: Encounter Jesus' glory and hear His messages to the seven churches.

required_passages.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega... Fear not, I am the first and the last... He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches... To the one who conquers...

segments.audio_script: Revelation begins with a vision of the exalted Christ and His direct words to real churches.

Listen to Revelation 1-3. John sees the Son of Man in blazing glory among lampstands, holding His churches. Jesus commands John to write to seven churches: commending faithfulness, correcting compromise, warning against lukewarmness, and promising reward to those who conquer. Each message ends, 'Hear what the Spirit says to the churches.'
These churches lived under pressure from persecution, idolatry, and doctrinal compromise in Asia Minor.
Revelation is first a discipleship book for churches. Jesus knows each church completely and calls for repentance, endurance, and covenant loyalty.
Key themes include Christ's authority, church accountability, repentance, perseverance, and conquering faith.
Reflect on this: Which of the seven church conditions most resembles your own spiritual state right now?
The risen Jesus walks among His people and calls them to overcome. Next, heaven's throne room reveals God's sovereign worship and rule.
